DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text and/or numeric identifier for a collection of B-cells (CD 20) preserved and mounted on a glass slide for microscopic study.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Expressed during B-cell ontogeny (early pre-B-cell to plasma cell) by human CD20 Gene (MS4A Family), 297-aa 33-kDa CD20 Antigen is a phosphorylated cell surface integral membrane protein shown to participate in B-cell proliferation, development, and differentiation into plasma cells. MS4A family proteins share structural similarity, sequence homology, and unique expression patterns among hematopoietic cells and nonlymphoid tissues. MS4A proteins contain 4 highly conserved transmembrane domains, flanked by N- and C-terminal cytoplasmic regions. CD20 may be involved in regulation of B-cell activation and may be regulated by protein kinases. (NCI)_A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study._Submission; a message submitted for the judgment of others.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Expressed during B-cell ontogeny (early pre-B-cell to plasma cell) by human CD20 Gene (MS4A Family), 297-aa 33-kDa CD20 Antigen is a phosphorylated cell surface integral membrane protein shown to participate in B-cell proliferation, development, and differentiation into plasma cells. MS4A family proteins share structural similarity, sequence homology, and unique expression patterns among hematopoietic cells and nonlymphoid tissues. MS4A proteins contain 4 highly conserved transmembrane domains, flanked by N- and C-terminal cytoplasmic regions. CD20 may be involved in regulation of B-cell activation and may be regulated by protein kinases. (NCI):A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Concepts.definition: B-lymphocyte antigen CD20 (297 aa, ~33 kDa) is encoded by the human MS4A1 gene. This protein plays a role in both the activation and proliferation of B-cells.
A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Property.preferredDefinition: Submission; a message submitted for the judgment of others.

Concepts.definition: Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
